review: The device itself isn't too bad, though I would prefer a Ethernet connection versus WiFi.  The remote feels a little on the cheap side, and the fact that a separate power connector is a little off-putting.  I am not fanatical about the prime video service, though, as more and more of the content requires extra "rental" fees even though I pay for the prime service.

review: WORTHLESS.  Trying to stream content - ANY content. DOES NOT WORK.  Plays AUDIO and screen that says (in British English) "DHCP Content UnauthoriSed" (yes that's an "s").  The SAME thing happened when trying to use a 2014 Samsung Smart TV with Amazon Prime content (with no need of a FireStick because it was a Smart TV with a menu interface).  Further, if you enable parental controls - you have to "type" a password in for EVERY SHOW!!  WHAT THE F###!  In the 1960's the "G-Rating" came out.  MOST SYSTEMS allow you to apply controls BY CONTENT TYPE - not EVERY #*$@'ing SHOW!  And there's NO KEYPAD!  It's like you have to play Nintendo entering "up left down - 'next page', left, left, up" every $$*@'ing SHOW !  Customer service said: "try pushing it in further",  "disconnect ALL other devices from now on", and due to the INTENSE HEAT the thing puts out (best one) "Ohhh - you have to disconnect it EVERY TIME YOU'RE NOT USING IT - it OVERHEATS".  What the F***!!!!!!
